website_summaries.verdict: A good way to get a thorough scalp massage anytime you want while showering.
pros: Uses thick teeth to dig deep into many styles and types of hair
Works shampoo in more thoroughly than fingers and brushes alone
Comes with two speeds for different styles of massages
cons: Difficult to replace batteries as the brush comes apart

customer_reviews.title: Almost a 5 star
customer_reviews.text: I would give this item a 5 star rating except that it just stopped working about a month ago. I definitely saw a difference in my hair after about 4-6 weeks of using this when I washed my hair (every other day). So I would say it does work to strengthen/stimulate healthy hair growth. Unfortunately it just stopped working and thinking it was the battery I went to change it and the battery compartment rusted. I was diligent about storing it in a dry place and taking off the rubber massage plate to let it fully dry out. I’m debating on buying a new one but not sure if I want to replace every 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: G. Pathak

customer_reviews.title: My scalp has been loving this!!
customer_reviews.text: So I saw this all over YouTube but on there site if you don't have a cup on code it's 40$ and that is just two much. I was happy when I came across this on Amazon for 20$. I have used this for about three weeks now and my scalp looks healthier then ever. This product massages and lifts dead skin and build up from your scalp. I recommend this for people who have prorasis and other scalp problems. Plus massaging the scalp promotes hair growth and who doesn't want that. This will need batteries and yes it really is waterproof! Hope this review helps!
customer_reviews.author: Malika R.

customer_reviews.title: Well it was great while it lasted (1 month)
customer_reviews.text: Well it was great while it lasted (1 month). The button that you use to turn it on wears down fast to the point where you can’t fix it. So I opened it up and yes there was water on the inside where the hardware is. I did manage to fix it but the next time I went to wash the button didn’t work again so I took it apart and his time the wires can loose so it’s completly dead. Not worth the 20 bucks. If your like me you can’t return it because it’s past 30 days. 😓
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Grips and pulls hair.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this brush to better clean and massage my scalp as I shampooed, but it's unusable. The brush doesn't glide through the hair, it drags. The rubber bristles of the brush are tacky/grippy and grip the hair strands (I have straight hair), tugging on them and pulling them out of my head. This happens when used dry or wet, with shampoo, brushing in straight lines, in one direction.
customer_reviews.author: Woody

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect (Need to fix the battery compartment so that water does not get there.
customer_reviews.text: The concept is very good and the massaging gel like is great(soft). However the it seems water leaks into the electronics/battery compartment and the product stops working after few weeks. I liked it so much though I bought it again and I did a hack with a "punch balloon" (just $1 dollar on dollar tree ), cut it and then placed it on top of it to protect against water. Look at the pictures. So far working perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: G. Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Great product, not 100% waterproof. Still great.
customer_reviews.text: Great product, cleans well and improves circulation to the scalp.. Which opens doors to tons of great side effects, hair growth, cleaner scalp... Healthier hair, more volume.. Etc. HOWEVER... Do not submerge item in water. It is not COMPLETELY waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Asmah sattar

customer_reviews.title: Handy to have.
customer_reviews.text: I used this while on a work trip for 30 days. I oiled my scalp and tilted my head down and used this massager to massage my head for a few minutes. I saw a lot more growth this time around than I did my last 30 days trip with just oiling and a regular finger tip massage. Great buy for me.
customer_reviews.author: Miamiu

customer_reviews.title: Not everyone can handle the vibration...but....
customer_reviews.text: Not everyone can handle the vibration on the head...but, you can get use to it! It starts to feel real relaxing. I swear, the first time I used it, the blood flowed to my head (scalp tingled) for about 4 days later. I'm seeing new growth with some oils I've purchased after a couple weeks of use. My hair doesn't really grow, so, I have been excited to see an even growth all over my head.
customer_reviews.author: VDog

customer_reviews.title: Eliminated dandruff completely for me! I don’t use batteries btw.
customer_reviews.text: This works. I had dandruff since I was a kid yo. My scalp has never been this clean before. This really does the job and promotes hair growth. I also use olive oil/Jamaican black castor oil and also TEA TREE OIL!!! and that also helps too. I’m a mixed black girl with tighter curls and wow. What is dandruff? Because I’m never getting that again. I don’t use batteries so it can vibrate. I honestly don’t care. I just use my hands and get this thing scrubbing. I like to use this roughly but you honestly don’t have to. I love this!
customer_reviews.author: Nilah Herrera

customer_reviews.title: Not very water resistant but feels great .!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this device but it has a major problem with “water resistance” , it isn’t.! I have used it regularly since I got it but today it was dead. I figured that was decent life for a single AA battery so I opened it up to replace the battery. Water everywhere !! Inside the battery compartment.! And no it was never submerged or stored upside down in a wet area. I was skeptical when I initially installed the battery because protection against water intrusion in a device meant to be used in the shower in minimal at best. Perhaps an “O” ring or a tighter fit would provide more “water resistance “
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Vibrating function died after less than 6 uses
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed with this product. After fewer than 6 uses, the vibrating function stopped working. It appears the product is not as water resistant as advertised. Water seems to have breached the battery compartment. New batteries and a thorough cleaning have not revived the unit. Even when working, the massage felt nice, but was not actually effective at controlling dandruff. There is no reason to waste your money on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for just over a month. Literally 3 days after my return window so I can return it like I do wish I could. First battery in lasted about 2 weeks after using a total of 3 times. Changed the battery, which requires a screwdriver so that’s annoying, used once, and now it’s dead again. I replaced the battery again and now it just won’t turn on at all. So now it’s going in the trash and I’m annoyed about the money I wasted.
customer_reviews.author: rachel

customer_reviews.title: No waterproof at all for Shampoo Brush
customer_reviews.text: It's been working well for about 2 weeks but suddenly stopped vibrating and the button didn't work so I've been used this without vibration for another 2 weeks. I just open up this for repair or fix but I got shocked. Just look at my picture, the water and bubbles inside!!! No waterproof!!! Rusty harness and unattached harness.. So.. weird.. How come shampoo brush is not waterproof!!!! I'm going to use this without vibration anyway... I wasted my money because there are many of cheaper brushes without vibration at Amazon. ^^
customer_reviews.author: WonChang Lee

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly scalp massage in the shower!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, this is a scalp massaging shampoo and conditer brush that feels great... and got me to finally start using conditioner :) The unit is solidly constructed so the battery is double protected from water. The plastic bristles feel great. The unit has a button that turns on the massage feature that, aside from feeling great, helps apply shampoo and conditioner. I think this brush feels great and works well with or without the massage function and I sometimes prefer the massage to be off.
customer_reviews.author: Josh F.

customer_reviews.title: although i have somewhat course hair (natural african american hair) it's not terribly thick, in fact it's pretty thin and I'm ...
customer_reviews.text: Not sure this is for course hair. i felt absolutely nothing on my scalp. although i have somewhat course hair (natural african american hair) it's not terribly thick, in fact it's pretty thin and I'm growing out a short hair cut. I got this to help massage oils or moisturizing shampoo but it does not work. I can hear the vibration, even feel it (sort of) with my hand but not on my scalp even when firmly pushing. (sorry just my experience)
customer_reviews.author: Bo

customer_reviews.title: Suweeet
customer_reviews.text: This company is legit. I let them know the first one they sent me wasn't working and they sent me a new one with no hassle. I used to have the black one, but it dropped from the top of my shower one day (never placing it up there again) and broke. The cool thing about this white one is that unlike the other black version, it has 2 vibrational settings. I use this when I shampoo, to help my scalp get some circulation, and to help spread on hair mask products (like castor oil). Worth buying for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Kaivon Hayat

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I was amazed by this product. I would shampoo my hair with this and do oil massage. MADE my scalp so healthy and got rid of my dandruff within a week. However I'm not happy that this stopped working after 2 months of use. After reading reviews in the products it says that it is waterproof and I don't think that was the issue and the writing wore off after first use. I'm reluctant to repurchase but after the results are received I'm a go ahead and do so.
customer_reviews.author: Aprill Burson

customer_reviews.title: Great Concept
customer_reviews.text: I've had my shampoo brush for a about a month now. I haven't seen any significant change in my scalp health from using it yet. I do think it's a bit over-hyped and a bit pricey for what it is but it does help a lot with shampooing and it's also good for just a casual scalp massage. All of the branding rubbed off of it after the second use but that's not really as important to me as the functionality of the product. I give it 4!
customer_reviews.author: SB777

customer_reviews.title: Not watertight!
customer_reviews.text: It worked great at first but when I went to change the battery it was wet where the battery was and had water inside it. If you're going to use in shower get a better one but if you are getting this to use in the shower then get a different one. Also I did not submerge this I only used it to shampoo the rubber massage pad with gasket doesn't keep water out at all.
customer_reviews.author: A. C.

customer_reviews.title: It's easy to clean and sanitize
customer_reviews.text: This thing works well. On my head, my bf's head, my friend's head. It's easy to clean and sanitize. Battery changing is easy and the one AA battery it takes lasts a good while, considering I use it every week when I wash my hair and my bf uses it just to scratch his head without damaging his scalp. The vibration is strong but not overpowering, and it also works well just manually manipulating it over the scalp if you don't want to fuss with batteries. I'm glad I gave this little guy a chance, it's working well for me so far!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Great for the scalp.
customer_reviews.text: This brush is great for massaging the scalp in the shower. I use it after leaving conditioner in my hair for a few minutes, then I come out my hair. I am certain that it's good for stimulating the hair follicles.
customer_reviews.author: Thurzday_Next

customer_reviews.title: Quality gone
customer_reviews.text: I bought this same brush twice- once in October 2017 and another in May 2018. Although I thought I was buying the same brush, I did not. The one I bought this May was very poorly made and not well put together. Within about two uses, water seeped in and it stopped vibrating. The entire brush falls apart because it won’t twist on securely. I would highly recommend the first brush I bought from them but cannot recommend whatever I bought recently and will be looking for another vibrating shampoo brush.
customer_reviews.author: Araceli

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I heard a lot of great things about this and I decided to give a shot. The vibrations are strong and my scalp felt so invigorated after I used it. I love it! I only wished they would have provided a battery already with it considering the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. I have super long hair, also have eczema and get really bad big chunks of dandruff behind my ears. My scalp hasn't felt this clean in a long time. I just wanted something to help really scrub and this def does the job. I was worried my hair would get tangled in it but that wasn't the case. Def would suggest if you get dandruff or have eczema or scalp psoriasis.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Died after a month and a half.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this brush! I've been using it every night since I got it. Shampoo, conditioner, leave in conditioner, just bc I wanna? It's great. Even with my super thick hair it does what it's supposed to. Update after about a month a half. It died on me. It won't turn on anymore and it's only 1 week past the return date so I can't get my money back. Changing my review to one star. I changed the batteries more than once so it's not that.
customer_reviews.author: Krissy H.

customer_reviews.title: Broken
customer_reviews.text: I REALLY wanted to love this product. I was so excited to purchase and use it after amazing reviews. I think I got a dud. I got it and used it 1 time it died while I was using it. I tried replacing the batteries 4 (four) times with fresh, brand new fully charged batteries and nothing, it has no power at all. I called customer service but because I waited more than 30 days due to not opening the package for 3 weeks once received because I was on vacation they basically said they couldn't help me. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Chandra Lee

customer_reviews.title: Massage Galore Head Tx
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased how it’s head forming, reaching through my thick 4C hair and has 2 speed settings. This device is not made for hair combing which is purposely excellent. The friction of the silicon bristles is catered to my massage needs, not intended for rough use (I’m heavy handed). This helps me relieve tension headaches and soothes tender scalp after washing. I simply add my favorite oil to my scalp and massage away my woes. I would definitely recommend this to my fellow wingmen in the medical group....we can use some stress relief.
customer_reviews.author: Adam payne

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: This scalp massage fits perfectly into the palm and has two vibration intensity levels, which I love by the way. Aside if this features it can be used wet or dry as the AA battery (not included) is shielded away in its ‘screw in’ compartment behind the silicone scalp massagers. The scalp massages are firm enough to give a great, vibrating massage without feeling too soft or causing the scalp to feel tender. Even though the removable silicone massage pad makes cleaning the device easy, I like to use it during conditioning over a plastic cap to cut down on product build up. I definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Vibrates hand more than scrub head, still feels good
customer_reviews.text: I use this to apply shampoo and conditioner. While the silicone scrub head works well and this feels good overall, I felt that my hand was vibrating more on the plastic handle than was the actual scrub head. Still, the silicone scrub head is high quality as is the seal that prevents water from getting to the batteries. I wish the head also rated separately from the handle, but for this price, the value is there.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne and Michael

customer_reviews.title: Hard plastic - not gentle or relaxing (esp for sensitive heads)
customer_reviews.text: The bristle things are actually really hard, so it's not comfortable. I was expecting maybe like...a soft silicone brush tips that could gently massage my head and flex with pressure. These are really hard, unmovable brush ends. Would not recommend if you have a sensitive scalp. I bought this so I could gently massage my head with special shampoo to treat dermatitis - was too rough for me. Also the vibration is really intense - wish there were a couple settings but there is only ON and OFF. Meh. If anyone knows of a softer bristle type head massager please let me know! Loved the concept but disappointing product.
customer_reviews.author: missgubba

customer_reviews.title: Makes me happy...but a cheap piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if it's a placebo or real, but my hair feels healthier and definitely looks shinier. Really, though, I just love the way it feels. UPDATE: I've gone through 2 of these. After about a month, they stop working...not just a dead battery, but the switch stops working. The first time, the company graciously sent a replacement. Maybe it's supposed to be a disposable product. So great for the 4-6 weeks it works, but then kaput. :(
customer_reviews.author: Missy Malick

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for curly girl hair method
customer_reviews.text: This shampoo brush is the perfect addition to any washing routine. I find that this brush works very nicely for the Curly Girl hair method since it helps to spread the paste-like shampoo around while also helping to detangle hair from the root. This is also nice for showers between washing to lift dirt and oil from your scalp with only water. Not to mention, it just feels good!
customer_reviews.author: Alexandria Zaken

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a more affordable dupe to the Vanity Planet brush. Big Mistake! The quality of the brush I received was shoddy, at best. The screw for the battery compartment was impossible to open! It's almost as if they used some sort of adhesive on it. It won't budge, regardless of what kind of screwdriver is used on it. The "vibrating" aspect of the brush is thus unavailable and nonexistent. I'm returning this. Please, do yourself a favor and get a different vibrating brush, or just buy a less expensive manual brush with no batteries required.
customer_reviews.author: HSM

customer_reviews.title: can't really use it.- maybe its not good for curls
customer_reviews.text: first and foremost, i didn't realize this vibrated. that might be on me, but i wanted this more as a brush to help move shampoo through my hair. however, i can't utilize this the way i want to because where i hold it, my hand hits the on button for the motor. i could take the battery out, but it works pretty terribly with and without the vibration. it simply gets stuck in my hair. maybe its because my hair is curly? either way, i can't use this at all.
customer_reviews.author: Shino

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I liked that there were two vibration settings. It really added to the massage and felt wonderful. After about five uses the battery died but I didn't get around to changing them. Went to change them today and found the battery enclosure had a puddled of water in it and had rusted. I take it out of the shower after each use and pull the rubber part off to dry it but I guess the battery ensure doesn't seal well to start with. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: rawmilkfarmer

customer_reviews.title: Great if it worked longer than a month...
customer_reviews.text: I got this and was able to use it for about a month before it completely stopped working. I loved how it made my scalp feel and I totally noticed the difference in my itchy scalp especially in the winter months. I don't know why it stopped working but I was very upset, it was a vital part of my shower routine. I guess I'll have to go looking for another one.
customer_reviews.author: Raven Hinson

customer_reviews.title: Feels so good on my scalp.  Don't know about the rest.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if it makes hair grow. I don't know that... yet. I've only had it a week. What I DO know is that it feels heavenly. If for nothing else but a luxurious feeling, it's worth the money. I can imagine that the massage must do good things for the scalp. But, dang, it feels so awesome that I could care less if it makes my hair grow.
customer_reviews.author: Glenda Hunt

customer_reviews.title: So relaxing!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this shampoo brush. I read a few reviews that state it gets a little loud, but I noticed whenever mine does this, it is just because I did not screw the brush part back on to the massaging part tightly enough. I just give it a little turn or even sometime just a tap and the noise stops. I find that I get better a better "clean" when I detach the brush from the when massage part when shampooing my hair, but I reattach when I moisturize. It feels great to let my ponytail down and turn this on my scalp, so relaxing!
customer_reviews.author: Wife, mother, SHOPPER!

customer_reviews.title: Makes shampooing quick and easy
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my 18 year old daughter. She has very, VERY thick hair that is also curly. It's hard to get down to the scalp without spending a lot of time shampooing. She washed her hair with this as soon as she received it. Not only did it make hair washing enjoyable, it was much quicker and so much easier. She says it was a nice massage and that she found it nicer overall. No tangled hair in her hands, no missed spots. This is definitely something to try for those with thick hair. The fact that it's like a nice massage makes it good for everyone!
customer_reviews.author: DestinyMasters

customer_reviews.title: I really have been missing this in my life
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for a while now and I love it. I have not really used it to wash my hair but after a wash while my pores are open I apply my oils and use it for five to 10 minutes. It just feels good in my and and it is not to firm on my head or too soft. It has two settings which is great when I am watching TV, I can use a different setting. This is a product I can recommend so far.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley G Roundtree

customer_reviews.title: Worth everything penny!
customer_reviews.text: Loving it so far. I purchased because I found it by watching Curly P and she recommended for shampooing. But what sold me on it 100% was another review I read, and the women has MS and so do I. She spoke of her dexterity issues and how this really helped while washing her hair. It does! I use mine when ever I can. It helps massage my scalp and feels like a mini massage every time I use it. It's kinda calming. I use it before n after I apply my hair oils and before and after shampoo and conditioner
customer_reviews.author: FredaFreda

customer_reviews.title: Fixed my scalp flaking!
customer_reviews.text: Despite using moisturizing conditioner, my scalp can be very dry and flaky. This little guy was more thorough than my hands could be for getting rid of build up. Right after a shower, I'd normally have some leftover dryness. But I didn't see any flakes after using this! I think it helped my conditioner work better on my scalp too. Totally effective!
customer_reviews.author: Kit

customer_reviews.title: Everything I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I only just recently got this, but so far it has been everything I was looking for. I get every kind of headache (sinus, migraine, stress) so I wanted battery, not manual because I wanted as close to the spa experience as possible. It’s easy to hold and feels great on my scalp. I have fine, thin, long hair which did not tangle and the “fingers” even felt comfortable on my forehead. The vibration speeds (there are 2) were pleasant and comfortable. I will check back in if it eats batteries or doesn’t last.
customer_reviews.author: Huskygrl

customer_reviews.title: Not a huge difference
customer_reviews.text: I don't notice a huge difference in my hair or scalp after using this. The first one I got, I believed it was damaged, as the rubber / silicone part that you use on your scalp had a curled lip, thus allowing water to get underneath it. I did email the company and they sent me a new one after I showed them pictures, but this one also allows for water to get underneath the silicone brush, so I'm not sure that it would be good for the batteries. I don't really use it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Erika R

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I loved this until it stopped working... It's NOT waterproof, so eventually the moisture fried it. Very bummed.
customer_reviews.author: Clark*sMom

customer_reviews.title: I’ve needed this my whole life!
customer_reviews.text: I’m so sad I’ve gone this long without this product! It’s seriously changed my scalp completely. I would also get dry patches in certain areas that shampooing my hand never seemed to reach but with this my scalp is completely clear! The massaging feature feels great and really works the product to the root. Only downside I have is after each use I have to remove the silicone bristles because water gets trapped beneath it.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: not a fan
customer_reviews.text: First off, the vibration feature is terrible! Wouldn't know whether or not vibrations on my head are relaxing because I was too distracted by the horrifying dreadlocks/tangles this product instantly created with the vibration. Also, it is not leakproof. Water gets into the battery compartment, which does not seem safe to me. I kind of enjoyed the feeling of it without the vibration, but it still created a lot of tangles. I did not find myself enjoying the benefits enough to want to use it, and I ended up throwing it out.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Not water tight, vibrating feature non-working after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this two stars because it's inexpensive and still functions as a scalp massager without the vibration. I purchased this in January and by April, only one of the vibration speeds was working. I thought the batteries were going bad so I replaced them. There was a lot of condensation in the battery chamber. The second vibration speed still didn't work and after one use with fresh batteries, both vibrating speeds were no longer working. This was really nice while it worked. The nubs are firm enough that you can still get a decent scalp massage with a bit of effort.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Breaks up product build up
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only been using it without the batteries, I have no intentions of putting batteries in. It works great with just ur hands alone. I already owned a plastic scalp scrubber but I decided to give this one a try. I thought my scalp was clean before, but this one broke up build on my scalp so much, I could actually see skin sitting on my hair when I got out. That alone told me that I guess I haven’t been washing my scalp good enough. After a few uses I no longer have any build up, this thing is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great purchaseN
customer_reviews.text: Very cute! I’ve had this thing in my shopping cart for maybe a year and finally bought it, it does everything it advertises I just thought the bristles would be a little stiffer like the other we have that doesn’t vibrate to help scratch the scalp and distribute the product. But it does great to help massage your head while in the shower, even outside of the shower it seems to hit the right spots on your head to help with stress/tension.
customer_reviews.author: Layia

customer_reviews.title: This thing is perfect for massaging your soapy head
customer_reviews.text: I like to pour the shampoo directly on it (it says to do so in the instructions) then I press it into my scalp, which is currently over grown with long hair due to the pandemic. The barbershop that I goto is closed, and has been for months. It's too dangerous for the barbers because they work around customer's heads where the rona likes to hangout to get into the openings of a person. So you got to make do with this during the pandemic.
customer_reviews.author: G. Tirebiter

customer_reviews.title: A must have for those with scalp issues!
customer_reviews.text: I have seborrheic dermatitis and due to this my scalp constantly itches, especially in the shower and this provides some relief. I feel like my hair is cleaner and shinier and my scalp itches less after using this product for a couple weeks. It has two modes. The stronger mode is pretty decent. It eats through batteries, though. I have had it for less than a month and I am already replacing the batteries. I've noticed some customers have said theirs broke very quickly, so I make sure to take it apart and dry the back off where the batteries are kept with every use. So far I haven't had any issues.
customer_reviews.author: MechInspector

customer_reviews.title: Amazon sells a $3 one that is much better.
customer_reviews.text: Very gimmicky. Vibration is very low and the "teeth" are spread out wide so it does not scratch the scalp. Amazon sells a $3 one that is much better.
customer_reviews.author: coolcat

customer_reviews.title: Works WONDERFULLY well. Massager has 2 settings. Push twice for harder setting.
customer_reviews.text: WORKS WONDERFULLY. Use in small circular motions. Needs AA batteries. Not included. Says it can be used in shower. But I dont. I think it will ruin it. I purchase a similar one without batteries. I also use it on my face to circulate blood flow to skin and promotes collagen.
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: A must-have in my routine
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this product because I was starting to struggle with an itchy scalp. It’s the first time I’ve ever dealt with an itchy scalp so I was down to try anything that seemed easy enough. I have fine, (in terms of diameter) thick (in terms of amount) hair and this works really well for me. I’m able to get good contact with my scalp and it’s really made a difference in terms of my scalp irritation. This is a must-use for me every time I wash my hair and I absolutley love how relaxing it is!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Genter

customer_reviews.title: Scalp Massage Feels Good
customer_reviews.text: I was not sure at first if this would perform as stated, but let me just say it works! I use this in the evening when I am trying to relax and watching TV for about 30 minutes. It leaves my scalp feeling so good (I guess that's the improved blood flow). As for it stimulating the growth of my hair I think it is too early to evaluate that, but I am hopeful. The product is well made and has two speeds. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: JennyO

customer_reviews.title: Has Dual Purposes

product_meta.title: Vitagoods Scalp Vibrating Massaging Shampoo Brush - Handheld Massager, Water-Resistant - Black
product_meta.description:
Color:BlackWe’ ve all had a scalp massage, right? It’ S one of the best parts of getting a haircut, and is a nice way to end a spa treatment. Afterwards you feel super relaxed, and your scalp might even have a tingly sensation. But scalp massage has a number of benefits you may not know about: it increases blood flow to your hair follicles which in turn promotes hair growth, distributes the natural oils of your hair which boosts shine, can help to control or even eliminate dandruff, and of course, gently cleanses and lightly exfoliates the scalp. Simply adding an extra step to your shower could Score you all of those perks: the Vitagoods Scalp massaging shampoo brush is a gently vibrating water-resistant scalp Massager that fits perfectly in the palm of your hand and takes your daily shampoo up a notch. The flexible rubber tips of the brush gently massage and invigorate your scalp while lathering up and distributing your favorite shampoo, and because the Vitagoods Scalp massaging shampoo brush is handheld, you can apply as little or as much pressure as you’ D like. 
how to use apply a small amount of your favorite shampoo to your scalp and distribute through the roots of your hair. Press the on/off button to activate the vibration to desired speed on your Vitagoods Scalp massaging shampoo brush. Hold the massager in the palm of your hand with the rubber tips facing away from you and the handle in between your index and Middle fingers for a firmer grip and better control. Starting at the front of your head, slowly glide the shampoo brush over your entire scalp, using as much or as little pressure as you'd like (let the massager work it's Magic!), and taking care to spend extra time on areas Where you may have noticed flaky or dry scalp. Note: if you have long hair, take care not to pull through the length of your hair. When finished, press the on/off button to deactivate the vibration, and rinse any shampoo suds or residue from the rubber tips. 

caring for your Vitagoods Scalp massaging shampoo brush remove the silicone bristles from the device and rinse it under the water faucet/shower after each use to ensure that all shampoo suds and residue has been removed. Use a damp towel to thoroughly clean the outside of the scalp Massager. Leave the items to dry outside of the shower, or somewhere where the brush can completely dry before re-assembling. Do not submerge in water. 

closing the battery compartment when closing the battery compartment, be sure to firmly press on the battery door and tighten the screw completely to prevent water from entering the device.
feature_bullets: BATH AND SHOWER ESSENTIAL - Take your shower or bathtime to the next level by incorporating the Vitagoods Scalp Massaging Shampoo Brush to your routine. It lets you enjoy the benefits of a scalp massage the fast and easy way!

WATER-RESISTANT CONSTRUCTION - Created to be a staple in your bathroom vanity or counter top, this luxurious massager brush features a water-resistant construction that can withstand daily contact with water.

BATTERY-OPERATED SHOWER TOOL - Score a rejuvenating scalp massage that will leave you relaxed. With this gadget that requires 1 AA battery, treat yourself to a fancy scalp massage without having to go to spas or hair salons.

CLEANSES AND SOOTHES - Designed with rubber tips that gently vibrates to ensure a generous lather, this handheld device lightly exfoliates your scalp to remove dandruff. It also soothes the scalp to help promote hair growth.

SAFE FOR KIDS - With its ergonomic design that's easy to use, kids and adults alike will enjoy using this handy tool. Its specially designed handle that's also suitable for tiny hands offers a firm grip for enhanced control.
